summary:
A Human Resources (HR) Specialist received a phone call from Employee A who reported that she was reviewing her Electronic Official Personnel File (eOPF) and found a beneficiary form SF-1152, Designation of Beneficiary for Unpaid Compensation for Employee B. The information included Employee Bs full name, date of birth, full SSN, address, and beneficiary information. HR Specialist immediately reported this breach to the eOPF Administrator.
The eOPF Administrator promptly accessed Employee As file and disabled her eOPF access until the file could be reviewed for accuracy. The SF-1152 for Employee B was removed from Employee As eOPF. The HR Specialist and eOPF Administrator verified that the SF-1152 was currently in Employee Bs eOPF. Employee As entire file was reviewed in order to ensure no additional documents were misfiled in her eOPF.

victim.victim_id: United States Department of Veterans Affairs
